intro: Anathallis yucatanensis, commonly known as the Yucatan spider orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, spider-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its flowers are usually small and pale green or white, with a distinct scent that attracts specific pollinators. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
